newsitem.title: UK: BT, BSkyB set for deal - paper.
newsitem.headline: BT, BSkyB set for deal - paper.

text.p: British Telecommunications and satellite television broadcaster British Sky Broadcasting seem set to announce a deal either this week or next that will hasten market penetration for new digital television channels, a newspaper reported on Monday.
The Times said a new company, Interactive Services Comapny (Isco), was being formed to subsidise the retail price of set-top boxes which are needed to receive and decode digital channels.
The price of the boxes might be cut to around 200 stg from 500 stg in order to encourage homes to switch to digital.
BT had been in negotiations with BSkyB, which is 40 percent owned by News International, for five months and was expectecd to emerge as Isco's single biggest shareholder, said the Times.
BSkyB, Midland Bank and Matsushita, the Japanese electronics company, would own the rest.
Isco would have to be launched in the next month or so if the boxes were to be in the shops by Christmas, the newspaper said.
